meanings.definition: A man who has been castrated, especially (in the past) one employed to guard the women's living areas at an oriental court.
meanings.sent1: The eunuchs watched over the palace's women.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, eunuchs were often trusted to protect the royal harem.
meanings.sent3: The eunuchs' job was to ensure the safety of the female residents.
meanings.sent4: The eunuchs stood as silent protectors in the court's inner chambers.
meanings.sent5: The eunuchs' loyalty to their duty was unwavering.

meanings.definition: A man or boy deprived of the testes or external genitals.
meanings.sent1: Some eunuchs were castrated for specific roles in society.
meanings.sent2: The boy, now a eunuch, faced a different future.
meanings.sent3: The eunuch's lack of certain body parts did not define his worth.
meanings.sent4: The eunuch's voice held a unique quality after the procedure.
meanings.sent5: The eunuch's identity went beyond physical changes.
